title: CRUISING
label: Stability
description:
When boarding the boat, keep the weight evenly distributed  for best stability and comfort.
Move gently around it while you get used to the new space .

title: CRUISING
label: Steering
description:
When under way, make small adjustments to the helm to keep a straight course and best stability.
Big corrections will lead to curvy performance and a less comfortable ride.

Adjust your speed to the circumstances.
It’s ok to create a wake and move fast in the open sea but allways slow down when approaching an anchorage, point of interst, swiming area or in the port.
Wake can cause damage to moored boats and may ruin a luch at anchor if it all ends up on the floor.

title: CRUISING
label: Safety Margin
description:
We have marked in the map the dangerous water rocks and shallows, anyhow, a safety distance must be kept from the shore at all times when cruising.
Please check your map often in order to locate the dangerous areas.

title: CRUISING
label: Look Out
description:
Keep a sharp look out at all times.
You may encounter other boats, swimmers, kayaks, etc in unexpected locations.
If at any moment your not sure on how to proceed, gently slow down or even stop for a moment to reassess.

title: CRUISING
label: Stability
description:
When cruising, you may encounter big swell created by the wake of a big motor boat or ship. 
In this case, slow down to minimum speed and approach the waves at a 45º angle.
Resume your course and speed once they are past.

title: CRUISING
label: Give way
description:
Give way by crossing through the back of these vessels independently of the approach.
Allways anticipate and execute your maneuvers with time and avoid last minute actions.

title: CRUISING
label: Give way
description:
When approaching another vessel head to head, both vessels will turn to the right and resume their course.
This manouver must be taken with anticipation and as soon as possible avoiding last minute calls.

title: CRUISING
label: Give way
description:
Give way to vessels approaching from your right hand side by crossing through the back of them.
Never cross their front path if you are the give way vessel.

title: CRUISING
label: Give way
description:
Give way to  sailing vessels independently of their approach when they are sailing. 
If their sails are not up then apply the general rule to give way to vessels coming from the right hand side.

title: CRUISING
label: Give way
description: When overtaking another vessel, kayak, windsurf etc. leave plenty safety distance between the boats.
